Solidarity Struggle of S. Korean Motor Workers Unions
articles.content:
Solidarity Struggle of S. Korean Motor Workers Unions 
    Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- Motor workers unions of Hyundai, Dae Woo and Kia businesses affiliated with the south Korean Confederation of Traden Unions, entered a full-scale solidarity struggle of regular and part-time workers for the right to existence, according to south Korean MBC.
 The unions decided to demand of the employers a special negotiation for the settlement of the issue of illegal dispatch of part-time workers and the issue of part-time job and form strike groups to stage sit-down strikes in tents at work places. They declared they would admit part-time workers in the trade unions of regular workers and stage a practical joint struggle.

Congratulations to Mongolian President
articles.content:
Congratulations to Mongolian President 
    Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Nambariin Enkhbayar on his election as Mongolian president.
  Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow in scope and develop in conformity with the demand of the new century and in the interests of the two peoples, the message wished the president great success in his responsible work for the prosperity of the country.

Greetings to King of Jordan
articles.content:
Greetings to King of Jordan
    Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Abdullah II, king of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan, on May 24 on the occasion of the 59th anniversary of her independence.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished the king and people of Jordan greater success in their work for the development of the country and peace in the Middle East.

Visits
    Pyongyang, May 25 (KCNA) -- A friendship delegation of South Hwanghae Province headed by Kwon Chun Hak, chairman of the Provincial People's Committee, left here today to visit China.
 A delegation of the Japanese Society for the Study of Kimilsungism arrived here today by air.
